medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient initially felt right lower quadrant pain after dinner 4 days ago, described as 'needle stabs' that came and went, worsening with movement. Experienced warmth at night, denied night sweats. Complained of chills, nausea, vomiting (watery), bloating, cramping, and general loss of appetite, but was able to eat lunch yesterday. Experienced epigastric pain in addition to RLQ pain the day prior to ED presentation. The RLQ pain worsened earlier today, leading to ED visit.
